stories.title: Build business universe: HVAC in Houston, TX
stories.description:
Use the Google Maps tool to find all HVAC businesses in Houston, TX. Run: python main.py universe "HVAC" "Houston, TX"
Save the full results list to the output file.

stories.title: Build financial benchmarks: HVAC
stories.description:
Scrape BizBuySell to build financial benchmarks for HVAC businesses. Run: python main.py benchmarks "HVAC" 20
Extract and save: median revenue, cash flow, margin, EBITDA multiple.

stories.title: Calibrate universe with benchmarks
stories.description: Read the universe from S-001 and benchmarks from S-002. Apply benchmarks to estimate revenue, EBITDA, and enterprise value for each business. Use utils/financials.py apply_benchmarks() and rank_businesses(). Output the full ranked list (all businesses, not just top 20).

stories.title: Collect UCC filings for top 20
stories.description:
Read the calibrated list from S-003. Take the top 20 by estimated value.
For each business, search the relevant state SOS UCC database for filings. Start with the state from the business address.
Record per filing: filing_number, filing_date, lapse_date, status (active/lapsed/terminated), secured_party_name, collateral_description.
Flag: is_sba_backed (secured party contains 'SBA' or 'Small Business'), is_all_assets ('all assets' in collateral).
Useful starting points: state SOS websites vary — try searching "<state> UCC search" or use opencorporates.com as a fallback.

stories.title: Collect SBA loan data for top 20
stories.description:
Read the calibrated list from S-003. Take the top 20 by estimated value.
Search SBA loan records at: https://data.sba.gov/dataset/7-a-504-foia
Or use the SBA FOIA bulk CSV files (7a and 504 approvals are public).
Match by: borrower_name (fuzzy) + borrower_city + borrower_state.
Record per loan: loan_number, program (7a/504), approval_date, approved_amount, term_months, bank_name, jobs_supported, naics_code.
Note: SBA data is available in bulk CSV — download and search locally rather than scraping the website.

stories.title: Collect job postings for top 20
stories.description:
Read the calibrated list from S-003. Take the top 20 by estimated value.
For each business, search for active job postings:
  1. Search Indeed: https://www.indeed.com/jobs?q=<company_name>&l=<city>
  2. Check the business website careers page if available
  3. Search LinkedIn if accessible
Record per posting: job_title, posted_date, salary_min, salary_max, pay_type (hourly/salary), is_active.
Categorize each role: technician / sales / management / admin / driver / other.
Key insight: hiring = growth signal; zero postings = stable or stagnant.

stories.title: Score and rank all businesses
stories.description:
Read calibrated businesses from S-003 and signals from S-004, S-005, S-006.
Compute an acquisition attractiveness score (0–100) for each business.

Scoring weights:
  40%  Estimated enterprise value (scaled within industry range)
  20%  UCC signals: active SBA loan = positive; tax liens = negative;        'all assets' collateral = business has real assets
  20%  SBA loan history: has 7(a)/504 = bankable, established
  20%  Job posting activity: hiring = growth; zero postings = stable

Output all businesses with scores and a brief signal_summary per business.

stories.title: Generate acquisition target report
stories.description:
Read scored businesses from S-007. Generate a Markdown report.

Report structure:
  1. Market Summary: total businesses found, estimated market size,      typical valuation range, median revenue/margin
  2. Top 10 Targets: for each — name, location, estimated financials,      score breakdown, UCC/SBA/jobs signals, recommended outreach angle
  3. Data Notes: confidence levels, data gaps, methodology

The report should be ready to share with a potential investor or acquirer.
